columns.text: In this problem, we will solve for the value of the initial salary that will make the present value of the job the same as the present value of attending Wilton University.

In order to solve for the value that will make him indifferent to the decision of attending university, we must look at the cost of attending Wilton University and the present value of working full time.

Based on the calculations in the previous calculations, the cost for attending the university is $\$122,715.64$ and the present value for working full time is $\$938,149.63$

Using the two values, we can solve for the present value of working full time that will make him indifferent between attending the MBA and continuing to work full time. To do this, we will simply add the two values in Step 2.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{New present value}&=\$122,715.64+\$938,149.63\\[15 pt]
&=\$1,060,865.27
\end{aligned}$$

The new present value is $\$1,060,865.27$

Using the same parameters as in the problem, with the growth rate being $3\%, the return rate being $5.5\%$, tax rate being $26\%$, and the time being $38$ years, we can solve for the value of the salary using this equation:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Present value of growth opportunity}&=\dfrac{\text{Salary}}{\text{Return rate}-\text{Growth rate}}\times 1-\left(\dfrac{1+\text{Growth rate}}{1+\text{Return rate}}\right)^\text{Time}\\
&\times (1-\text{Tax rate})
\end{aligned}$$

Substituting the value, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\$1,060,865.27&=\dfrac{\text{Salary}}{0.055-0.03}\times1-\left(\dfrac{1+0.03}{1+0.055}\right)^{38}\\
&\times(1-0.26)
\end{aligned}$$

Divide both sides by $17.7008$ to get the salary value.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Salary}&=\dfrac{\$1,060,865.27}{17.7008}\\[15 pt]
&=\$59,933.18
\end{aligned}$$

The salary that will make him indifferent between studying and working is $\$59,933.18$
